meanings.definition: To counteract or undo the effects of programming.
meanings.sent1: She needed to deprogram her mind from the negative thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped him deprogram his fear of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: After watching too many scary movies, she had to deprogram her brain to stop being scared of the dark.
meanings.sent4: He decided to deprogram his routine and try something new every day.
meanings.sent5: The deprogramming process was challenging but ultimately liberating.

meanings.definition: To remove or eliminate programmed beliefs or behaviors.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to deprogram himself from the habit of procrastination.
meanings.sent2: The cult survivor had to deprogram the teachings that were ingrained in her mind.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she needed to deprogram her love for chocolate to stick to her diet.
meanings.sent4: The therapy sessions helped him deprogram his addiction to social media.
meanings.sent5: The deprogramming of his old beliefs opened up new possibilities for him.
